channel.title: Indianz.Com News
channel.description: Indianz.Com - Your Internet Resource for Native American, American Indian, Alaska Native and Canadian Aboriginal/First Nations News.

item.title: 'Do your job': Tribes slam Trump administration on sovereignty and homelands
item.description: The Trump administration's point person on Indian policy took a brutal beating as tribal leaders warned about dire threats to their sovereignty.

image.title: 'Do your job': Tribes slam Trump administration on sovereignty and homelands

item.title: 'We are not asking for a hand-out': Native contracting program under scrutiny amid success
item.description: A federal program has provided economic opportunities for companies owned by tribes and Alaska Native corporations but it has attracted some negative attention.

image.title: 'We are not asking for a hand-out': Native contracting program under scrutiny amid success

item.title: Trump administration faulted for efforts to address 'epidemic' of missing and murdered in Indian Country
item.description: The Trump administration plans to spend more money on the crisis of missing and murdered Native Americans amid complaints that it isn't doing enough to address what is widely considered an epidemic.

image.title: Trump administration faulted for efforts to address 'epidemic' of missing and murdered in Indian Country

item.title: Indian Country awaits latest budget proposal from Trump administration
item.description: President Donald Trump is releasing his latest budget request, a document that signals his administration's commitment to fulfilling it trust and treaty obligations.

image.title: Indian Country awaits latest budget proposal from Trump administration

item.title: State of Indian Nations kicks off busy week for tribal leaders
item.description: Fawn Sharp is delivering her first major address as the new leader of the National Congress of American Indians.

image.title: State of Indian Nations kicks off busy week for tribal leaders

item.title: Aaron Payment seeks re-election as leader of Sault Ste. Marie Tribe
item.description: Treaties, economic development and improving services for his people are among Aaron Payment's priorities as chair of the largest Indian nation east of the Mississippi.

image.title: Aaron Payment seeks re-election as leader of Sault Ste. Marie Tribe

item.title: Rep. Markwayne Mullin: The state of our union is strong
item.description: I am proud to support our President and his agenda that will move our country forward.

image.title: Rep. Markwayne Mullin: The state of our union is strong

item.title: Rep. Tom Cole: Congress plays important role in authorizing military force
item.description: I believe that the president should bring to Congress a clear and comprehensive strategy to protect American interests, deter reprehensible acts and eliminate jihadi forces that are operating and destabilizing our regional allies.

image.title: Rep. Tom Cole: Congress plays important role in authorizing military force

item.title: YES! Magazine: How to turn your yard into an ecological oasis
item.description: Replacing grass with even a few plants native to your region can save insects and the ecosystems that depend on them.

image.title: YES! Magazine: How to turn your yard into an ecological oasis

item.title: Rising drug prices stoke national debate, and a bold plan in California
item.description: Native Americans and Hispanic people, and people of lower economic status, are diagnosed with diabetes at a higher rate than the average, according to the Centers for Disease Control.

image.title: Rising drug prices stoke national debate, and a bold plan in California

item.title: Native Sun News Today: Native lawmakers weigh pipeline shield bills
item.description: The looming construction of the Keystone XL Pipeline through unceded treaty territory drew plenty of attention during the first two weeks of the 2020 South Dakota Legislature.

image.title: Native Sun News Today: Native lawmakers weigh pipeline shield bills

item.title: Tim Giago: The aftermath of the Wounded Knee story
item.description: I tell all writers then and now, if you come out to Indian Country to write about us, do your damned homework.

image.title: Tim Giago: The aftermath of the Wounded Knee story

item.title: Closing loopholes or slamming doors? Advocates blast SNAP changes
item.description: The Trump administration's proposed changes to the nationwide food stamp program are coming under fire.

image.title: Closing loopholes or slamming doors? Advocates blast SNAP changes

item.title: Elizabeth Cook-Lynn: The GOP has no sense of shame
item.description: Lakotas and Dakotas are reminded that the role of shame in our cultures is a time-honored way to show our humanness.

image.title: Elizabeth Cook-Lynn: The GOP has no sense of shame

item.title: Native Sun News Today: Lakota Food Summit to debut
item.description: An impressive lineup of presenters is slated for the first annual Lakota Food Summit.

image.title: Native Sun News Today: Lakota Food Summit to debut

item.title: Gabe Galanda: The United States must help stop disenrollment
item.description: Indigenous America is once again facing off with disenrollment.

image.title: Gabe Galanda: The United States must help stop disenrollment

item.title: Northwest tribes conclude winter meeting with call to protect environment
item.description: Northwest tribes want the federal government to respect opposition to controversial environmental decisions that impact their traditional lands.

image.title: Northwest tribes conclude winter meeting with call to protect environment

item.title: Sinema, McSally fall in line with parties as Senate acquits Trump
item.description: Most lawmakers fell in line with their respective parties as the U.S. Senate voted to acquit President Donald Trump on two articles of impeachment that could have forced his removal from office.

image.title: Sinema, McSally fall in line with parties as Senate acquits Trump

item.title: BirdRattler to speak about collaborations with tribes at MSU's Berger Lecture on February 11
item.description: Loren BirdRattler will speak about an initiative that is building mutually beneficial research collaborations between Montana State University and tribal communities.

image.title: BirdRattler to speak about collaborations with tribes at MSU's Berger Lecture on February 11

item.title: Editorial: To legalize the sale of alcohol on the reservation; that is the question
item.description: Oglala Sioux Tribe members will vote in March on whether marijuana should be legalized on the Pine Ridge Reservation and whether alcohol should be served in its casinos.

image.title: Editorial: To legalize the sale of alcohol on the reservation; that is the question
